The possibilities are endless as long as the meetings are centered around pizza. The Yale Pizza Society will maintain a presence online through various social media channels and a dedicated website. On these platforms, photos, reviews, infographics, interviews, and videos, all revolving around pizza, will be shared. The culminating project for the Yale Pizza Society will be a ranked list of the top pizza restaurants in New Haven, as determined by the members of the Yale Pizza Society. This ranking will be published once per academic year with the winning restaurant awarded a Yale Pizza Society plaque.

name: Yale Poker Society - For Graduate & Professional Students
mission: YGPS is an interest group for playing and learning about poker within the Yale community. Our mission is to bring together students that share an interest in poker, provide intellectual stimulation, and develop quantitative reasoning skills that can be applicable in other aspects of life.

name: Yale Polo — An Undergraduate Association
mission: Yale Polo is dedicated to the promotion of the sport of Polo and of interest in equestrianism across Yale's campus and in the greater Yale community.

name: Yale Postdoctoral Association (YPA)
mission: The Yale Postdoctoral Association (YPA) exists to support and enrich Yale's mission in the pursuit of scholarship, education, preservation, and practice, through facilitating postdoctoral scholars at Yale University in their efforts toward the betterment of the University and society. Read more about our mission and bylaws here: https://ypa.yale.edu/what-ypa/mission-statement-and-bylaws

name: Yale Postgraduate Association (YPGA),
mission:
The Yale Postgraduate Association (YPGA) works to enhance the experience and development of the postgraduate community. Through a combination of educational initiatives and social activities, the YPGA assists postgraduate scholars in obtaining the skills necessary to pursue academic and non-traditional careers in science and beyond. We nurture a diverse, inclusive community through the following pillars:
-To connect postgrads through mailing lists and in-person events.
-Organizing career development events, networking, and social engagement events.
-Build a sense of community amongst postgraduates.
-Serve as a voice for postgraduates.
-Encouraging inclusion and diversity among all postgraduate scholars at Yale University and advocating on their behalf to achieve a supportive and enriching environment.
-Strengthening the skills of postgraduate scholars as both mentors and mentees by facilitating access to opportunities for mentorship training and experience.

name: Yale Precision Marching Band
mission:
The Yale Bands is a thriving cultural community. Its members are given opportunities to prepare and perform great music; learn about the arts and their place in society and international cultures; and develop skills to become leaders. Through a robust series of musical activities, many Bands members work with and become serious performers, conductors, composers, arrangers, writers, archivists, historians, photographers, producers, choreographers, media producers, critics, and teachers. Band members develop and master these skills through service to the University, performing and producing commencement music, benefit concerts, university ceremonies, theater shows, international tours, reading sessions for classes, and special events.
The YPMB is one of twelve scatter-style marching bands in the country. What does this mean? Most marching bands spend their time on field spelling their name in script or making a swirly line formation while playing the complete works of Andrew Lloyd Webber. We perform halftime shows composed of comedy segments, during which we spell witty things on the field and play really cool rock music. Between formations we run around wildly (hence the clever name "scatter band"). For example: in the past we've done a sketch about the rise and fall of Saddam Hussein as a Yale professor, accompanied to "It's Gonna Be Me" and "Live and Let Die," one in which we played the "Godfather" theme and dug up Jimmy Hoffa on the 30-yard-line (this was during our trip to Giants Stadium) and the unforgettable George W. Bush sketch, which involved a line of white-shirted bandies and the playing of Eric Clapton's "Cocaine." We are also a pep band. During the winter we support Yale's hockey and basketball teams every weekend. This time of year often leads to playoff travel; we've been to Lake Placid, Ann Arbor, MI, MADISON SQUARE GARDEN, and more. We are a mobile attack unit. If there's anywhere on the Yale campus (or, really, the East Coast - we're flexible) that needs some relief from pretension, we'll be there to provide.
We could go on for pages trying to tell you what we are. You'd be best off to show up and find out, really. You won't be disappointed.
For more, visit us here: https://bands.yalecollege.yale.edu/bands/yale-precision-marching-band/frequently-asked-questions

name: Yale Program on Climate Change Communication
mission: We conduct scientific studies on public opinion and behavior; inform the decision-making of governments, media, companies, and advocates; educate the public about climate change; and help build public and political will for climate action.

name: Yale Psychology Graduate Committee on Diversity and Inclusion
Yale Student Salsa Society
mission: Yale Student Salsa Society is a non-competitive salsa dance group at Yale University. We want to provide a safe space for whoever is interested in learning more about salsa or wants to have a location where they can practice. We want everyone who joins to have a good time dancing and interacting with other members of the group.

name: Yale Real Estate Club - an Undergraduate Organization
mission: Yale Real Estate Group (YREG) is dedicated to empowering real-estate interested undergraduate students through comprehensive learning and professional development opportunities in real estate investment, development, and design. Our diverse offerings -- including a curated curriculum, inspiring speaker events, and hands-on projects with leading corporations -- aim to create an intellectually stimulating, collaborative, and engaging environment for our members to follow their interests and develop their knowledge base and skillsets.

name: Yale Salsa Society - A Student Organization
mission: Yale Salsa Society aims to bring together anyone interested in Latin dance and the space and time to learn and practice while meeting other members of the Yale and New Haven communities.

name: Yale Science Communication - a Graduate Student Organization
mission: We as an organization aim to ignite scientific engagement across diverse communities and train effective science communicators. To this end, we speak about science at venues ranging from libraries to local bars across New Haven and beyond. As Yale graduate students and postdoctoral scholars, we have a responsibility to make science accessible to the general public, especially to under-served communities. We believe that anyone can engage with science and use it in their lives.

name: Yale Shakespeare Club
mission: The Yale Shakespeare Club seeks to foster a love of Shakespeare's works. Both long-time bardolators and Shakespeare novices are welcome to explore together the "infinite variety" of Shakespeare through many media, such as reading, film, scholarship, and performance. We also facilitate frequent, low-stress Shakespeare performances on campus for anyone to enjoy or perform—the best way to fall in love with the bard.

name: Yale Society of International Law
mission: The Yale Society of International Law (YSIL) aims to provide a comprehensive platform for YLS students to pursue their academic and professional interests in international affairs and international law.

name: Yale Student Business Society
mission: YSBS is dedicated to promoting professional development in the areas of business, leadership and management within the Yale community. Our mission is to educate and foster leadership and entrepreneurial ideas by providing educational resources, and organizing networking and career development events. We work to create a more unified, inclusive and collaborative business community at Yale.

name: Yale Student Energy Association
mission: Increase public awareness about sustainable energy, its challenges, and its opportunities. Connect Yale students, lead energy ventures and enhance their potential. Accelerate student-led-initiatives and make Yale a leading player in energy initiatives of colleges and universities. Capitalize on interdisciplinary majors, concentrations, and interests of students, to envision and promote viable solutions to pressing energetic and environmental problems.

name: Yale Student Lettuce Club
mission: The Yale Student Lettuce Club aims to promote the creation of lettuce-positive culture at Yale as an essential part of students' physical, emotional, and spiritual well-being. Through events like the annual lettuce eating competition and the all-nighter arts festival, we foster lettuce awareness on campus and beyond. We welcome all members of the Yale community to join us in our mission. Ranch not included.

name: Yale Student Magic: the Gathering Club
mission: Yale Student Magic: the Gathering Club seeks to promote and facilitate the card game Magic: the Gathering within the Yale-New Haven community and to provide a space for learning, friendly competition, and collaboration.

name: Yale Student Marimba Band
mission: Y-SMAB brings traditional, African marimba and percussion to Yale, to properly demonstrate where the marimba originated, the power of its music, and the community it can bring together when played joyfully in groups.

name: Yale Student Pokemon Go Players
mission: The Yale Student Pokemon Go Players is an organization for students at Yale who participate in group gaming events for the Niantic game Pokemon Go.

name: Yale Student Science Diplomats
mission: The mission of Yale Student Science Diplomats is to foster a scientifically informed electorate, which we pursue through science communication, advocacy, and policy initiatives. In the service of this mission, we pursue several specific initiatives each year with the aim of engaging the public and policymakers in scientific discourse.

name: Yale Student Songwriters' Collective
category: Arts: Other, Performance: Instruments, Performance: Singing
mission: The Yale Student Songwriters' Collective is an organization for undergraduate students that provides a space for Yale's songwriters to come together, collaborate, receive feedback, and learn from each other. Our primary goal is to help all levels of songwriters cultivate their songwriting skills. We also aim to introduce students to other aspects of songwriting including production, business, and branding through guest speakers and forums. Lastly, we provide a platform for Yale students to perform and promote their music in a variety of private and public venues. Ultimately, the YSC strives to bring creators from all sides of Yale together to explore their artistry in a supportive community.

name: Yale Student U.F.O. Society
mission: The Yale Student UFO Society aims to contribute to the scientific research surrounding the UAP enigma by conducting rigorous research, promoting responsible dialogue, and creating an inclusive space for people to discuss the mysteries of unidentified flying objects.

name: Yale Students Against Wrongful Convictions
mission:
Mission Yale Students Against Wrongful Convictions ("YSAWC")
aims to help remedy, prevent, and increase public awareness of
convictions that violate the precept of proof beyond a reasonable
doubt, fair trial rights, or the other procedural rights of criminal
defendants. In addition to the significant harm to the individuals
directly affected by these convictions, these miscarriages of justice
fundamentally undermine the legitimacy of and public faith in the
criminal justice system. Our mission is threefold: First, we will
provide legal assistance in the fight against real cases of wrongful
convictions; Second, we will educate students on the common and
systemic causes of wrongful convictions and the difficulties in
challenging them; Third, through confronting wrongful convictions,
we hope to encourage students to think critically about how the
criminal justice system creates unjust obstacles for all defendants
regardless of whether they are "guilty" and disproportionately
harms the poor, people of color, and other disadvantaged groups.

name: Yale Students for a National Health Program
mission: Yale Students for a National Health Program (SNaHP) hopes to represent future physicians in advocating for a federally-funded universal healthcare system, in addition to providing a space for all students to participate in conversations and debate about these policy solutions. We collaborate with our allies at the national SNaHP organization, as well as Physicians for a National Health Program (PNHP).

name: Yale Students for RCV
mission: Yale Students for Ranked Choice Voting is a nonpartisan organization dedicated to promoting awareness of ranked choice voting (RCV) in the Yale community and beyond. In doing so, we seek to rally support for this reform, which will reduce the temperature of our bitter political climate and make elections more truly democratic and representative of the diversity of identities and ideas of the population as a whole.

name: Yale Students for Uyghur Freedom
mission: Organizing the Yale community to understand, research, and combat the ongoing genocide against Uyghurs in China.

name: Yale Students' Minecraft Coalition
mission: A place for Yalies interested in Minecraft to gather, meet other Yalies interested in the popular sandbox game, and game together to bond and connect.

name: Yale Supreme Court Society
mission: As individuals from all political perspectives come together, our mission is to foster an intellectual and dynamic space to seriously and respectfully discuss and debate legal and constitutional issues. We strive for philosophical consistency in navigating the intersection of government and morality. The foundational basis for our discussions will be provided by previous and ongoing Supreme Court cases.

name: Yale Surgical Interest Group
mission: YSIG is an organization for Yale Medical School students interested in exploring careers in surgery and its subspecialties. With support from the Department of Surgery, students are afforded the opportunity to become junior members of the surgical community.

name: Yale Undergraduate Student Dairy Association
mission: We are dedicated to the promotion of dairy foods and the development of a safe environment to consume dairy products as means to support a critical industry to the national economy while familiarizing with the challenges faced by dairy workers and industry.

name: Yale Swing, Blues, and Fusion
category: Arts: Other, Arts: Visual Arts, Cultural, Health/Wellness, Performance: Dance, Performance: Other, Social, Cultural: Mixed Race
mission:
Yale Swing, Blues, and Fusion is the non-competitive swing and blues dancing community on campus and in the New Haven area. We provide a space for people to get together and dance in a fun, informal setting.
COMMUNITY
Yale Swing, Blues, & Fusion is an intentional dance community. We intend to be a friendly, welcoming, including, and safe space. By entering our community, we ask that you help us uphold those values.
INCLUSIVITY
We strive to give a good time to everyone coming to our community. To help us do that, we ask everyone to dance, regardless of their gender, age, race, religion, sexual orientation or experience! It's more fun when everybody's dancing! We also like to talk to people in a friendly way! Treat people as your fellow human beings!
CONSENT
Both on the dance floor and outside of it, we make sure to ask someone's consent before we do anything. We ask people to dance verbally, and if they want to lead or follow, or if they may dance your preferred role.
If anyone makes someone else uncomfortable, they will be held accountable for doing so. Accidents happen, but it doesn't mean someone doesn't have to apologize!
If anyone is uncomfortable during a dance, we encourage them to ask for more space, a lighter touch, or anything they need. If they don't feel safe, they can walk away from the dance. Please let an organizer know if they're feeling discomfort!
It's perfectly fine to turn down a dance. Be gracious and move on!
COLLABORATIVE WORK
We hope that everyone who finds these values awesome will share them! If anyone sees behavior that seems to not be respecting those values, we can encourage them to either address it with that person or with an organizer.
Our community is run by members of GSAS and the community and is completely based on volunteering work.

name: Yale Symphony Orchestra
mission: The Yale Symphony Orchestra (YSO) is an inclusive organization that is committed to elevating the musical discourse at Yale by sharing an exciting annual program of high-quality performances, workshops, and social activities.

name: Yale Taiwanese Student Association
mission: We are a student association run by Taiwanese graduate students and postdocs to improve our networking and provide supports. We hold some social events like board game weekend or hot pot parties to strengthen our connection.

name: Yale Tango Club - for students and affiliates
category: Arts: Other, Cultural, Food/Culinary, Health/Wellness, Leadership, Medical/Nursing/Public Health, Performance: Dance, Science/Technology, Social, Sports/Outdoors, Residence Halls, Cultural: Mixed Race, Special Interest
mission: The Tango Club promotes and shares the study and diffusion of the popular and cosmopolitan art form of Argentine tango. We offer classes for all levels, welcome beginners, and organize weekly and monthly practice and dance events aimed at bringing together the tango community at Yale and with the general public. Unfortunately, due to Yale visitor restrictions, we would not be able accommodate for non-Yale facilitated individuals in our events.

name: Yale to Keyframes, a Student 3D Graphics Club
mission: We're a group of 3D modelers and animators promoting the field of computer graphics by teaching (and doing) the development of innovative, accessible, and stylized 3D videos and assets. Whether you're into nostalgic y2k visuals or sleek new ads––beginner or advanced––this is the place for all things computer graphics

name: Yale Ultramarathon Student Organization
mission: Yale's Ultramarathon Club is open to all undergraduate and graduate students interested in ultrarunning regardless of experience. Ultrarunning entails running for distances further than a marathon, spanning up to multi-day, continuous running endeavors where one's will to keep moving forward supersedes all other predisposed genetic and skill factors. As an appreciation group, we host meetings and invite guest speakers to discuss training, nutrition, gear, and race strategies to grow the sport throughout the Yale community.

name: Yale Undergraduate Barbecue Club
mission: Bring together undergraduate students with a love for barbecue and host events that would promote both mastery of the craft and educate students on barbecue's complexity.

name: Yale Undergraduate Brief Writers
mission: We create a community of those interested in deep analysis of Constitutional law. We prepare briefs on fictional Supreme Court cases, which we submit to brief-writing competitions.

name: Yale Undergraduate Data Analysis Association
mission: YUDAA is committed to teaching undergraduate students methods of data analysis, especially predictive models, and providing a space for students to work in teams to build better models and enhance their skills.

name: Yale Undergraduate DJ Collective
mission: The Yale DJ Collective aims to create a space for people passionate about electronic music through practical and educational opportunities dedicated to aspiring and current DJs. YDC will host weekly meetings where members will practice new skills, workshops geared toward people first learning how to DJ, and showcases throughout the semester. YDC members will push the boundaries of music by creating live mashups, making each song their own.

name: Yale Undergraduate Federalist Society
mission: The Society's main purpose is to sponsor fair, serious, and open debate about the need to enhance individual freedom and the role of the courts in saying what the law is rather than what they wish it to be. We believe debate is the best way to ensure that legal principles that have not been the subject of sufficient attention for the past several decades receive a fair hearing.

name: Yale Undergraduate Tabletop Association
mission: Our mission is to provide a space for students to try out board games and meet new people. We hold weekly game nights and teach members how to play each game. We also hold weekend events and get-togethers to promote a common community centered around good times and tabletop gaming.

name: Yale Undergraduate Hedge Fund Association
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Hedge Fund Association (YUHA) serves as an interactive and inclusive platform to connect students and alumni with a shared interest in finance. YUHA was formed to provide curious students an opportunity to learn about a sector that typically excludes undergraduates and aims to strengthen Yalie connections, current and past through events hosted at TSAI City, firm visits, workshops, networking events, and informational literature. As an educational and occupational resource for its members, YUHA will arrange for Yale alumni in the hedge fund field to share their experiences (remotely, via Zoom) and advise students of potential internship opportunities. Foremost, YUHA will be the catalyst for our members to gain interest in a career in finance.

name: Yale Undergraduate Law Journal
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Law Journal is a student-written and student-run journal of legal scholarship. As the only pre-law publication on campus, the YULJ aims to reach a wide interdisciplinary audience by allowing its writers to explore the various aspects of law which they may find interesting or relevant in our time. The journal has three branches: a Law Journal, which is a semi-annual publication featuring long-form papers, published in print and digital forms; a Blog, which is a digital platform that frequently publishes shorter-form articles on pressing legal issues; and a Podcast, which is an audio platform where legal scholars can regularly be hosted and where we can cover law-related news, domestically and internationally.

name: Yale Undergraduate Learn to Skate Program
mission: To provide a fun after school program for local elementary school children to learn how to ice skate and an opportunity for skaters at Yale to teach skating lessons.

name: Yale Undergraduate LGBTQ+ Business Alliance
mission: YULBA aims to help historically marginalized LGBTQ+ individuals to prepare for careers in business by providing educative and networking opportunities.

name: Yale Undergraduate Looking for Friends
mission: Yale Undergraduate Looking for Friends aims to teach and promote the card game Looking for Friends (找朋友) at Yale. Our weekly games are open to anyone, regardless of skill level or experience. We hope to provide an intellectual challenge and a space to meet other people looking for a complex yet enjoyable card game. The best part, however, of joining YLFF is the friends one makes along the way.

name: Yale Undergraduate Medical Society
mission: Medicine in the twenty-first century is increasingly cross-disciplinary and technology-based. Our mission is to empower the many pre-medical students who are also interested in other fields such as economics and computer science to lead the next wave of development in the medical field by creating opportunities unique to them that do no yet exist anywhere. We also aim to expose pre-medical students who are exclusively interested in the medical field to related disciples such as healthcare economics and healthcare technology development.

name: Yale Undergraduate Numismatic Association
mission:
The Yale University Numismatics Association works to build inclusive, accessible spaces for students interested in the study of currency, from rare coins and paper money to tokens and medals. We welcome members of all interests and experiences, from those with existing collections to students with no prior exposure to numismatics.
Our monthly meetings are structured around themed, hands-on viewing sessions at the Yale Numismatic Collection. We also invite guest speakers, share members' collections, and host short presentations. Our topics and themes are driven by member interests.

name: Yale Undergraduate Quantum Computing
mission: Our mission is to promote and facilitate the participation of undergraduates in quantum information science at Yale, to contribute to the larger community studying quantum information science, and to hasten the arrival of the second quantum revolution.

name: Yale Undergraduate Saxophone Collective
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Saxophone Collective aims to promote the practice and performance of saxophone repertoire at Yale. The YUSC exists to provide additional opportunities for saxophone performance outside of Yale's traditional larger ensembles, both in solo and chamber music settings, as well as provide a shared community for saxophonists at Yale. The YUSC will hold concerts, solo recitals, and other performances, as well as masterclasses, with the goal of increasing the presence of saxophone music at Yale and helping members to grow as musicians.

name: Yale Undergraduate Screenwriting Syndicate
mission: The Yale Undergraduate Screenwriting Syndicate is a writers' group that seeks to encourage student screenwriters of all majors, backgrounds, and ambitions to keep up with their scripts throughout the semester. Through regular group meetings, we aim to give students a space to practice their craft with other screenwriters and to help establish a writing routine for students who struggle with continuing their writing.

name: Yale Undergraduate Sports Analytics
mission: We are undergraduates passionate about the field of sports analytics. Members discuss the current state of advanced statistics in various sports and attempt to contribute to the field through original research.

name: Yale Undergraduate Virtual Reality and Emerging Technologies Club
mission: YUVAR intends to introduce and broaden the scope of VR and AR research, discussion, and interest at Yale. We offer workshops and projects that help our members discover and advance their interests in the mixed reality space.

name: Yale University Chaplain's Office
mission: This is a word that we in the Yale University Chaplain's Office use and enthusiastically commit to putting into practice often.  The very foundation of the work that we do at Yale is about creating an environment that feels welcoming to all people.  Whether you are part of a particular religious/spiritual community or not, we welcome you!  This website is designed to give you a deeper sense of the kind of work that we do at Yale as well as to promote religious literacy for the greater purpose of fostering understanding and appreciation of global religious and spiritual traditions.  Whether you are visiting this site to find out more about how to connect with a particular individual, group or space, to learn about our events and programs or just to explore in general, we hope that you find what you need and that you even discover something new along the way that feeds your soul.  We hope that you visit this site or our office often.  You are always welcome!

name: Yale Urban Law & Policy Society
mission: The Yale Law Urbanists promotes dialogue among students about legal and policy issues affecting cities. The group hosts speakers who work in and with local government on a broad array of topics, including food and environmental justice, real estate and planning, and federalism.

name: Yale Venture Club for Students and Scholars
mission:
1.	Yale Venture Club is an independent, non-political, and non-profit organization dedicated to promoting social and intellectual networking for all students within the Yale community, particularly for graduate students interested in equity investment and entrepreneurship.
2.	Unite entrepreneurs, industry experts, VC/PE investors, and all others with a genuine interest in the venture field among the Yale community.
3.	Establish a strong and long-lasting connection among all club members (including but not limited to current students and alumni across all Yale schools).
4.	Aim to connect investors and startups resources within and beyond the Yale community to help further the growth of venture capital talents and startup founders, thus further enhancing the influence among different communities beyond the Yale campus.

name: Yale Vermilion Theater for Students and Scholars
category: Cultural, Performance: Theater, AACC Affiliate Org
mission: We are inspired to perform plays with bilingual (Mandarin and English) versions, so as to facilitate cultural conversations and build a bridge between the theater work based in these two language mediums. We also see great value in forming such a cultural club in light of the spike in anti-AAPI sentiments since the start of the pandemic. We are naming the club "Vermilion Theater" as the vermilion bird (a phoenix-like being) is a symbol of tenacity and resilience in Chinese mythology. As we learn about the possibility of safely returning to theater in a world forever changed by COVID, we hope that our organization will bring long-isolated people together, share a sense of normalcy and build a much needed community.

name: Yale Veterans Network
mission: The YVN's vision is to make Yale the employer of choice for veterans, reservists, and guardsmen while creating a community to support and encourage the career development and growth of all its members.

name: Yale Vot-ER
mission: Healthy Communities Powered By A Healthy Democracy: Vot-ER is a nonpartisan organization working to bring voter registration into the health system

name: Yale Well
mission: To foster an environment that supports and advances students' wellness, in all its dimensions, through innovative programs, opportunities for self-discovery and growth, and the cultivation of a compassionate campus culture.

name: Yale Young Global Scholars
mission: Yale Young Global Scholars (YYGS) is one of the most globally diverse, two-week academic summer programs in the world. Serving over 2,000 students from 150+ countries and all 50 U.S. states, YYGS distributes over $3 Million USD in need-based financial aid to both domestic and international students.

name: Yale, Center for Biomedical Innovation and Technology (CBIT)
mission: Educating the next generation of biomedical innovators and maximizing impact.

name: Yalies4Palestine - Yale's Student Palestinian Advocacy Organization
mission: To organize Yale's campus to support the human rights of the Palestinian people through political advocacy and cultural awareness.

name: YDS Asian Students Association
category: Cultural, Social, AACC Affiliate Org, Cultural: Mixed Race, International
mission: Asian Students Association (ASA) provides a place for fellowship in the sharing of an ethnic bond and common faith. ASA is an inclusive space and community for students of Asian heritage, whether domestic or international students, along with fellow YDS students that are interested in advocacy of Asian/American issues. Frequent meetings roundtable discussions on current Asian/American theological issues, academic forums for the advancement of Asian-American theology, and fellowship gatherings.

name: YDS Commencement
mission: The official Yale Connect page for the Yale Divinity School Commencement. Events, information, and communications for all graduating students.

name: YDS DivFarm Student Group
category: Cultural, Food/Culinary, Health/Wellness, Religious/Spiritual, Social, Sports/Outdoors, Special Interest

name: YDS Film Club
mission: The YDS Film Club hopes to host film evenings that address student interests throughout the semester, in order to provide students with on-campus study breaks, as well as to redevelop a sense of safety and calm on-campus. The YDS Film Club will sponsor film nights, opera screenings, and performance livestreams for both educational purposes and for fun, and will invite students from across YDS (and potentially across campus) to join for evenings of socially-distanced fun.

name: YDS Office of Student Affairs (OSA)
mission:
The Yale Divinity School Office of Student Affairs seeks to enrich all aspects of student life at YDS. The Office of Student Affairs exists to:
- Advocate for Yale Divinity School Students
- Support the Community Life Committee (CLC)
- Empower Yale Divinity School Student Government (YDSG)
- Nurture YDS Student Group leadership
In addition, the YDS Office of Student Affairs assists students with personal matters, academic concerns, and resources for students with disabilities. The Office of Student Affairs team is dedicated to ensuring that all students have the resources needed to flourish during their years at YDS.

name: YDS Office of Vocation and Leadership
YDS Paracleats Soccer Team
mission:
The Yale Divinity School Paracleats are an intramural soccer in the Yale University Intramural League.
People of all enthusiasm and abilities are welcome!  It does not matter if you played in college or have never kicked a soccer ball, we can find a place for you and want you on the team.

name: YDS SAGES
mission: This group will provide peer support and advocacy for those entering divinity school having already spent considerable time in prior occupations, professional careers, parenting or other family support, or other life experiences.

name: YDS Student Org Leaders
mission:
The YDS Student Leaders' Handbook is the central resource for all Student Leaders of Clubs and Representatives in the YDS Student Government. The website is the official handbook of the YDS student org community, and events are regularly posted for training and development of our student leaders.
Student leaders needing access should email Kit.Heeley@yale.edu for access.

name: YDS Women's Center
mission: The YDSWC is a community welcoming of all people and focuses specifically on issues surrounding those who identify in various ways with womanhood. The YDSWC commits to creating a brave space on campus where women and allies can gather to share resources, knowledge, and stories, and advocate for women's rights.

name: YEP! at Yale - an Undergraduate Organization
mission: YEP! is an entirely free entrepreneurship program for local high school students in New Haven. By inviting local students onto campus to participate in an entrepreneurship incubator, YEP! hopes to develop the next generation of entrepreneurs and strengthen town-gown relations.

name: YHack Organization
category: Academic, Media/Technology, Pre-Professional, Science/Technology, Tsai CITY Affiliate Org
mission: YHack aims to foster a diverse, innovative and collaborative environment in which students are equipped to use computer science fundamentals to devise real-world solutions. We hope to provide students with opportunities to develop novel approaches to problems and gain access to a passionate network of passionate individuals.

name: YLS Career Development Office
mission:
Yale Law School's Career Development Office (CDO) provides a variety of resources to assist you in making informed career decisions. A good starting point is the career pathways section of this site where you can learn about the variety of employment opportunities available. Use the toolkit for student job seekers to guide you through the self-assessment, employer research, application and interview processes. Explore CDO's educational and interview programs and myriad resources that are at your disposal as your job search progresses.
In the fall, every first-year student will be assigned to one of our four attorney counselors. After that, you are welcome to connect with a counselor of your choice.
We look forward to collaborating with you during your time at YLS and beyond.

name: YLS Coker Fellows
mission: Those students who will be third-year students (or the equivalent) in the Fall are eligible to apply for positions as Coker Fellows, teaching assistants that work with the first-year small groups.

name: YLS Student Representatives
mission:
Each year, eleven elected Student Representatives act as an advocate for students, as a liaison to/from the Law School administration, and as partner to various constituents on and off campus.
Student Representatives participate in faculty meetings, appoint students to serve on faculty committees, meet monthly with the Dean, bi-weekly with members of the Office of Student Affairs, and occasionally with other faculty and administrators as needed.
Student Representatives advise the Office of Student Affairs on new organizations and on annual funding allocations.

name: YLW+
mission:
YLW+ works to advance the status of women and underrepresented gender identities at YLS and in the legal profession at large. To realize this mission, we create programming, resources, and mentorship opportunities to bolster our members' pursuit of their professional and personal goals.
YLW+ is a non-partisan organization committed to building a supportive community at YLS and beyond.

name: Young Associates from Newly Independent States
mission: The purpose of YANIS shall be to promote and develop the community of Yale students and postdocs from the Newly Independent States (Armenia, Azerbaijan, Belarus, Estonia, Georgia, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Latvia, Lithuania, Moldova, Russia, Tajikistan, Turkmenistan, Ukraine, Uzbekistan) by the means of language and cultural accommodations.

name: YSE Commencement
mission: The official Yale Connect page for the Yale School of the EnvironmentCommencement. Events, information, and communications for all graduating students.

name: YSE Office of Admissions and Financial Aid
YSE Office of Career and Professional Development
YSE Office of Development and Alumni Services
YSE Office of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
YSE Office of Student Affairs
mission:
Our goal is to provide developmental advising and mentoring as we help YSE students identify and understand the resources and options available, empowering them to make more informed choices that facilitate opportunities to help find a sense of belonging and build relationships across differences. In this process, we hope to foster wellbeing, leadership, and life skills so that they can thrive personally and intellectually at YSE and beyond.
The Office of Student Affairs seeks to be transparent in the way we do our work and to engage with students and colleagues in ways that improve the services we provide and the experiences of all the students we serve.

name: YSE YaleCONNECT Sandbox
mission: To test features of YaleCONNECT

name: YSM Committee on the Well-Being of Students
mission: The mission of the YSM Wellness Committee is to foster an environment of healthy and sustainable living among students at YSM.

name: YSM Food Insecurity Task Force
category: Food/Culinary, Health/Wellness, Medical/Nursing/Public Health, Special Interest

name: YSM Office of Alumni Affairs
mission: Whether facilitating volunteer efforts, an event or philanthropic support, the office is dedicated to serving and promoting the interests of current and future alumni, as they pursue their role as leaders in medicine, healthcare delivery, and the biomedical sciences. The office works closely with the alumni leadership of the Association of Yale Alumni in Medicine (AYAM), the AYAM committees, and other alumni organizations to identify, create and implement alumni programs that serve and enhance the School's education, research and clinical missions.

name: YSM Office of Student Affairs
mission:
The Office of Student Affairs at the Yale School of Medicine helps students navigate their medical education from Orientation to Graduation.
We provide academic advising, support student groups and wellness, promote student life and community building activities, and act as the primary resource for students who are seeking to find balance in their medical school experience.

name: YSM Social Committee
mission: The YSM Social Committee is responsible for planning social events open to the entire student body. We plan events from ClubMeds/PubMeds, to smaller study breaks.

name: YSPH - Innovate Health Yale (IHY)
mission: InnovateHealth Yale, housed at the Yale School of Public Health, supports the creation of innovative solutions to challenges in public health and education for underserved communities in the United States and low-resource countries. We support programming, mentoring, and funding to accelerate impact and make difference in the world.

name: YSPH - Sustainable Health Initiative (SHI)
mission: The YIGH Sustainable Health Initiative strives to solve complex global health challenges through business-minded approaches, creative problem-solving methods, and robust international collaboration.

name: YSPH Climate Change and Health Concentration
mission:
Climate change represents the greatest public health challenge of the 21st century, and has profound implications for human health, today and in the future. To this end, the Yale Center on Climate Change and Health (CCCH) utilizes research, education, public health practice, and service to help achieve a world with a stable and safe climate; one in which the public's health and diverse ecosystems can thrive.
The YSPH Concentration in Climate Change and Health will work to address the severe shortage of public health professionals with the educational background needed to address climate change as a public health issue.
The study of climate change and health is multi-disciplinary and should interest students from all YSPH departments. Climate change is an environmental exposure (Dept. of Environmental Health Sciences) that can affect both infectious (Dept. of Epidemiology of Microbial Diseases) and chronic (Dept. of Chronic Disease Epidemiology) diseases. Research about the relationship between climate change and health can involve sophisticated modeling (Dept. of Biostatistics and others). Behavioral change, mental health, and social justice are major concerns (Dept. of Social and Behavioral Sciences). Finally, health management expertise is needed to develop mitigation and adaptation strategies, and climate change involves thorny policy issues (Dept. of Health Policy and Management).

name: YSPH Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging
mission: Across the YSPH community, the dean, faculty, staff and the alumni have adopted mentorship, recruitment, retention and professional development practices to help meet our goal of having an outstanding and diverse School of Public Health—a place that better reflects the local, national and international communities we study. The Diversity Ambassadors at YSPH exist to serve as advocates for students and liaisons between the student affinity groups and the larger Diversity, Equity, Inclusion and Belonging Committee (DEIB).

name: YSPH Global Health Concentration
mission:
The Yale School of Public Health is a leader in Yale University's commitment to improve health across the globe through research, education and community engagement. The School uses science to foster health, promote innovation, train leaders and make a difference in the world. Faculty research spans a variety of fields including chronic and infectious diseases, implementation science, environmental health, behavioral determinants of health, and policy and administration.
The Global Health Concentration builds on all these experiences and emphasizes an integrative problem–solving approach to global health issues and to diseases and conditions that afflict developing and developed countries.
Students who complete this concentration will be well prepared for positions in a variety of organizations—public and private, national, bilateral and multilateral—dedicated to global health challenges.

name: YSPH Maternal Child Health Promotion Track
YSPH Moves: a Graduate Student Group
mission: Welcome to Yale Dance and Movement! Our mission is to create a vibrant and inclusive space where graduate students from all disciplines can come together to experience the joy of dance, and foster connections within the diverse Yale community. Through teaching a variety of dance styles, we aim to promote both physical and mental well-being. Our group is dedicated to celebrating diversity, embracing unity, and encouraging self-expression, all while nurturing a sense of belonging. Join us as we blend the art of dance and movement!

name: YSPH Office of Public Health Practice
mission: - The Office of Public Health Practice (OPHP) supports the mission of the Yale School of Public Health (YSPH) by fostering sustainable and equitable collaborations among students, faculty, and community partners. OPHP serves as the YSPH nexus for practice-based learning, community programs, and public health workforce training and is a bridge to domestic and international agencies engaged in public health work. OPHP holds the vision that all experiential learning opportunities at YSPH are anti-racist, equitable, mutually beneficial, focused on health and wellness, and fully resourced and supported. The office is a resource for YSPH students, faculty, and staff as well as organizations and public health practitioners seeking training and support for the Applied Practice Experience, internship, and practicum courses.

name: YSPH Stolwijk Fellowship
mission: Summer Internship funding for work in environmental health sciences.

name: YSPH Strength Training & Weight Lifting Student Group
mission: To create a network around strength training for novices and professionals alike.  Strength training is an important part of health, and the knowledge of how to safely and efficiently participate in strength training should be shared within a community.

name: ¡Oyé! Spoken Word
category: Performance: Other, La Casa  Affiliate Org
mission: ¡Oye! is a performance group dedicated to creating a space for poetry and performance on Yale's campus. We welcome all members of the Yale Community. No experience necessary (most members have never performed or written poetry prior to ¡Oye!)
